description.narrative: By the end of 2015, in targeted priority areas of intervention, communities and child protection actors develop competencies for a public opinion and community/family practices favorable to child protection.

mailing-address.narrative: 18 Rue Pierre & Marie Currie Marcory Zone IV Boite Postale 443 Abidjan 04 Côte d'Ivoire

sector.narrative: Alternative care reform and service provision
Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Community and home based maternal and newborn care
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Parent/caregiver education and programmes on violence, exploitation and abuse - across the life cycle
Protective services for children on the move
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Social and behaviour change communication related to FGM/C
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Cote D'Ivoire United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Cote D'Ivoire (Generation Unlimited)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2015, in targeted priority areas of intervention, communities and child protection actors develop competencies for a public opinion and community/family practices favorable to child protection.

description.narrative: 100 per cent of localities planned to be covered by the child protection outreach program and community based networks have been reached. Over 6 million people have been informed on the risks of violence against children including through the outreach program and media campaign implemented with support of UNICEF CDI. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2017

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Targetted parents/primary caregivers reached by programmes addressing child-rearing practices

actual.value: 2017:67,000 people participated in the CP Community Outreach Programme. Over 6 million people were reached by the media campaign.
